item.title: 加拿大将于 10 月 22 日对中国钢铁和铝产品征收关税
item.description: 加拿大公布了一份数十种中国钢铁和铝产品的清单，加拿大将从三周后开始对这些产品征收 25% 的关税。【原文：Canada published a list of dozens of Chinese steel and aluminum products on which it will place a 25% tariff, starting in three weeks.】

item.title: 以色列与伊朗的冲突为何左右着中东局势
item.description: 几十年来，以色列和伊朗之间的冲突一直影响着中东地区。在肆虐该地区的众多冲突中，他们的冲突一直是最具爆炸性的冲突之一。双方相互攻击，大多数时候都是悄无声息地进行，而伊朗往往是通过代理人进行攻击，同时避免升级为直接战争。【原文：The low-boil conflict between Israel and Iran has shaped the Middle East for decades. Of the many conflicts that have roiled the region, theirs has long been among the most explosive. The two have attacked each other — mostly quietly and in Iran’s case often by proxy — while avoiding an escalation into direct war.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加航空公司出售债券和贷款为夏威夷借款再融资
item.description: 阿拉斯加航空集团公司（Alaska Air Group Inc.【原文：Alaska Air Group Inc. is selling around $1.5 billion total of US high-grade bonds and a loan secured by its frequent flyer program, to refinance debt tied to its acquisition of airline Hawaiian Holdings Inc.】

item.title: 施莱格尔称，瑞士央行可再次降息并干预外汇市场
item.description: 瑞士国家银行新任行长马丁-施莱格尔（Martin Schlegel）表示，瑞士国家银行可以在必要时干预货币市场，并随时准备再次降低利率。【原文：The Swiss National Bank can intervene in currency markets if required and stands ready to lower interest rates again, according to new President Martin Schlegel.】

item.title: 福特要求英国提供补贴以促进电动汽车销售
item.description: 福特汽车公司呼吁英国政府重新提供补贴，以帮助汽车制造商实现销售目标，因为消费者对电动汽车避之不及。【原文：Ford Motor Co. is calling on the UK government to reintroduce subsidies to help carmakers hit sales targets as consumers shun electric vehicles.】

item.title: Enverus 公司称 2025 年页岩生产成本将上升 2.8%
item.description: 据行业咨询公司Enverus称，随着勘探者扩大天然气开采范围并扩大侧井，美国页岩钻探者的油田服务成本预计将在2025年出现反弹，收回今年的部分跌幅。【原文：Oilfield-service costs for US shale drillers are expected to rebound in 2025, clawing back some of this year’s drop, as explorers expand the hunt for natural gas and extend sideways wells, according to industry consultant Enverus.】

item.title: 中东紧张局势令交易员惶恐不安，股市 "岌岌可危
item.description: 在创下历史新高一天后，周二美国股市回落，波动性上升，原因是有报道称伊朗准备在未来 12 小时内对以色列发动弹道导弹袭击。【原文：One day after hitting an all-time high, US stocks are in retreat Tuesday and volatility is rising on reports that Iran is preparing to launch a ballistic missile attack against Israel within the next 12 hours.】

item.title: 南非下一阶段企业与政府协定目标增长 3
item.description: 南非总统表示，南非政府与企业之间下一阶段的合作重点将是重振过去十年来每年仅增长 1% 的经济。【原文：The next phase of a partnership between the South African government and business will focus on reviving an economy that’s barely expanded 1% a year over the past decade, the president said.】

item.title: 激进投资者的战略要求让美国首席执行官更快离职
item.description: 据巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）的一份报告称，在与激进投资者的斗争中，美国的首席执行官们正在加快退出的步伐。【原文：Chief executive officers in the US are heading for the exits faster in battles with activist investors, according to a report from Barclays Plc.】

item.title: 2024 年最佳季度美国投资级债券回报率为 5.8
item.description: 彭博指数显示，美国高等级公司债券在过去三个月中实现了今年以来的首次季度上涨，回报率达到 5.8%，创下了自 2023 年最后一个季度以来的最佳表现。【原文：US high-grade corporate bonds logged their first quarterly gain this year in the past three months, returning 5.8% for its best performance since the final stanza of 2023, according to a Bloomberg index.】

item.title: 飓风在收获前夕摧毁南部棉花作物
item.description: 在棉花收获季节，棉花种植者正面临着海伦飓风带来的毁灭性损失和延误，这标志着本已疲软的市场利润又一次受到打击。【原文：Cotton growers are facing devastating losses and delays from Hurricane Helene just as harvest was beginning, marking the latest blow to profits in an already weak market.】

item.title: 液化天然气贸易商选择支付而非运往德国
item.description: 据德国国有终端运营商称，一些液化天然气贸易商为了在亚洲追逐更高的利润，选择为最初打算运往德国的供应支付费用。【原文：Some liquefied natural gas traders are opting to pay fees for supplies they initially intended to send to Germany in order to chase higher profits in Asia, according to the nation’s state-owned terminal operator.】

item.title: 激进投资者 Petrus 出售其持有的几乎全部 Immofinanz 股份
item.description: Petrus Advisers Ltd. 在宣布持有 Immofinanz 股份并呼吁与其大股东就该奥地利房东的 "战略替代方案 "进行谈判仅一周后，就出售了其大部分股份。【原文：Petrus Advisers Ltd. sold most of its Immofinanz shares just a week after announcing a stake and calling for talks over “strategic alternatives” for the Austrian landlord with its majority owner.】

item.title: Monarch 完成 47 亿美元机会型信贷基金募集
item.description: 专门从事不良债务的资产管理公司 Monarch Alternative Capital 表示，该公司完成了 47 亿美元的机会主义信贷基金，超过了 35 亿美元的目标。【原文：Monarch Alternative Capital, an asset manager specializing in distressed debt, said it closed a $4.7 billion opportunistic credit fund, exceeding its target of $3.5 billion.】

item.title: 三星全球裁员数千人
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，作为全球裁员数千人计划的一部分，三星电子公司正在东南亚、澳大利亚和新西兰裁员。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. is laying off workers in Southeast Asia, Australia and New Zealand as part of a plan to reduce global headcount by thousands of jobs, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 美联储库克认为人工智能可提高生产力，但具体程度尚不明确
item.description: 美联储理事丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）表示，她预计人工智能将推动生产率增长，但她认为这一预测存在 "很大的 "不确定性。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook said she anticipates artificial intelligence will drive a pickup in productivity growth, but sees “substantial” uncertainty around her forecast.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利称赞预算紧缩，赞比亚债券反弹

item.title: Unieuro 创始人反对 Fnac 收购，理由是价值被严重低估
